canonical_explanation.text: Our neighbourhood is the area around our home where we live. It has many important places like markets, hospitals, parks, post offices, banks, and places of worship like temples, mosques, and churches. Many people called community helpers work in our neighbourhood to help us. Doctors keep us healthy, postmen deliver our letters, policemen keep us safe, firefighters put out fires, and shopkeepers sell us things we need. We should be kind to our neighbours, keep our area clean, and live together happily.
rules: A neighbourhood is the area around our home.
Many important places like markets, hospitals, parks, and post offices are in our neighbourhood.
Community helpers like doctors, postmen, policemen, and firefighters help us every day.
We should be kind to our neighbours and help each other.
We should keep our neighbourhood clean and safe.

questions.question_text: Where do we go to buy vegetables and fruits?
questions.explanation_correct: We go to the market to buy vegetables and fruits. The market is a place where shopkeepers sell many things we need.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A hospital is for sick people, a post office is for letters, and a police station is for safety. We buy vegetables and fruits at the market.

questions.question_text: Who delivers letters and parcels to our home?
questions.explanation_correct: The postman delivers letters and parcels to our home. The postman works at the post office and brings our mail every day.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A doctor treats sick people, a policeman keeps us safe, and a shopkeeper sells things. The postman is the one who delivers letters and parcels.

questions.question_text: Where do children go to play on swings and slides?
questions.explanation_correct: Children go to the park to play on swings and slides. The park is an open space with trees, flowers, and play equipment.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A hospital is for treatment, a bank is for money, and a post office is for letters. Children play in the park.

questions.question_text: Who keeps us safe and catches bad people?
questions.explanation_correct: The policeman keeps us safe and catches bad people. Policemen work at the police station and help maintain law and order.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A doctor treats illness, a postman delivers letters, and a shopkeeper sells goods. The policeman is the one who keeps us safe.

questions.question_text: Where do we go when we are sick?
questions.explanation_correct: We go to the hospital when we are sick. Doctors and nurses at the hospital take care of us and give us medicine to get better.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A market is for buying things, a park is for playing, and a library is for reading. We go to the hospital when we are not well.

questions.question_text: Who puts out fires?
questions.explanation_correct: A firefighter puts out fires. Firefighters are very brave. They rush to the place of fire in their fire engine and use water to put out the fire.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A postman delivers letters, a shopkeeper sells goods, and a teacher teaches students. The firefighter is the community helper who puts out fires.

questions.question_text: Where do we post a letter?
questions.explanation_correct: We post a letter at the post office. The post office collects letters and sends them to the right address through the postman.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A hospital is for health, a bank is for money, and a market is for shopping. We go to the post office to post letters.

questions.question_text: Who checks our health and gives us medicine?
questions.explanation_correct: The doctor checks our health and gives us medicine. When we are sick, the doctor examines us and tells us what medicine to take.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A teacher teaches, a policeman keeps us safe, and a gardener grows plants. The doctor is the person who takes care of our health.

questions.question_text: Where do people keep their money safely?
questions.explanation_correct: People keep their money safely in a bank. The bank stores money and keeps it safe for people.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A park is for playing, a market is for buying things, and a school is for learning. A bank is the place where people keep their money safely.

questions.question_text: Who sells things in a shop?
questions.explanation_correct: The shopkeeper sells things in a shop. We go to the shopkeeper to buy things like groceries, stationery, and other items we need.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A doctor treats patients, a postman delivers mail, and a firefighter puts out fires. The shopkeeper is the person who sells things in a shop.

questions.question_text: Where do we go to catch a bus?
questions.explanation_correct: We go to the bus stop to catch a bus. The bus stop is a place in our neighbourhood where buses come to pick up and drop off people.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A hospital is for treatment, a market is for shopping, and a bank is for money. The bus stop is where we wait to catch a bus.

questions.question_text: Who keeps the streets clean?
questions.explanation_correct: The sweeper keeps the streets clean. Sweepers wake up early and clean our roads and streets so that our neighbourhood stays neat and tidy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Doctors treat patients, postmen deliver mail, and shopkeepers sell things. The sweeper is the community helper who cleans our streets.

questions.question_text: Where do people go to pray?
questions.explanation_correct: People go to a temple, mosque, or church to pray. These are places of worship where people go to thank God and pray.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A market is for shopping, a post office is for letters, and a bus stop is for buses. People pray at temples, mosques, and churches.

questions.question_text: The fire station has ___.
questions.explanation_correct: The fire station has fire engines. When there is a fire, firefighters drive the fire engine to the place of fire to put it out with water.
questions.explanation_incorrect: School buses are for schools, aeroplanes are at airports, and boats are at rivers or seas. Fire engines are kept at the fire station.

questions.question_text: Which of these is a place in our neighbourhood?
questions.explanation_correct: A park is a place in our neighbourhood. It is a nice open space with trees and play areas where people go for walks and children play.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A forest, desert, and ocean are far away from our homes. A park is the place in our neighbourhood where we can play and relax.

questions.question_text: Your neighbour aunty is carrying heavy bags. What should you do?
questions.explanation_correct: You should help her carry the bags. Helping our neighbours is a good habit. It makes our neighbourhood a friendly and caring place.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Laughing, running away, or closing the door is not kind. Good neighbours help each other. We should always be ready to help.

questions.question_text: There is a fire in a building near your home. Who should you call?
questions.explanation_correct: You should call the firefighter. Firefighters have the training and equipment to put out fires safely and save people.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A postman delivers letters, a doctor treats the sick, and a teacher teaches. When there is a fire, we must call the firefighters for help.

questions.question_text: Meera wants to send a birthday card to her grandmother who lives far away. Where should she go?
questions.explanation_correct: Meera should go to the post office. She can post the birthday card at the post office, and the postman will deliver it to her grandmother.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A hospital is for health, a bank is for money, and a fire station is for firefighters. The post office is the right place to send letters and cards.

questions.question_text: People in a neighbourhood are throwing garbage on the road. What will happen?

options.text: The area will become dirty and unhealthy

questions.explanation_correct: If people throw garbage on the road, the area will become dirty and unhealthy. Garbage attracts flies and germs that can make people sick.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Throwing garbage does not make things beautiful or help flowers grow. It makes the neighbourhood dirty, smelly, and unhealthy for everyone.

questions.question_text: Rahul has a toothache. Which community helper should he visit?
questions.explanation_correct: Rahul should visit a dentist, who is a special type of doctor. The dentist will check his teeth and help fix the toothache.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A policeman keeps us safe, a postman delivers letters, and a shopkeeper sells things. For a toothache, we need to see a dentist (doctor).

questions.question_text: It is Diwali. Your family gives sweets to your neighbours. Why do they do this?

options.text: Because they have too many sweets
To show love and live happily together
Because the neighbours asked for sweets

questions.explanation_correct: Sharing sweets with neighbours during festivals shows love and helps everyone live happily together. It builds friendship and a caring community.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Sharing sweets is not because we have too many or because someone asked. It is a way to show love, care, and togetherness with our neighbours.

questions.question_text: Someone has stolen a bicycle from your neighbourhood. Who should you inform?
questions.explanation_correct: You should inform the policeman. The police help when something is stolen and work to catch the person who took it.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A doctor treats illness, a firefighter puts out fires, and a sweeper cleans streets. For a theft, we should inform the policeman at the police station.

questions.question_text: Where would you wait to catch a train?
questions.explanation_correct: You would wait at the railway station to catch a train. The railway station is where trains stop to pick up and drop off passengers.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A bus stop is for buses, a post office is for letters, and a market is for shopping. The railway station is where we go to catch a train.

questions.question_text: Your neighbourhood park is full of litter. What can everyone do to help?
questions.explanation_correct: Everyone should clean up the park together. When neighbours work together to keep common places clean, the whole neighbourhood becomes better.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Stopping visits, throwing more litter, or blaming others will not help. Cleaning up together is the best way to take care of our neighbourhood.

questions.question_text: Which of these is NOT a community helper?
questions.explanation_correct: A robot is not a community helper. Community helpers are real people like doctors, postmen, firefighters, and policemen who help us every day.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Doctors, postmen, and firefighters are all community helpers. A robot is a machine, not a community helper.

questions.question_text: A police station is a place where ___ work.
questions.explanation_correct: Policemen work at the police station. This is where they keep records and plan how to keep the neighbourhood safe.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Doctors work at hospitals, postmen work at post offices, and teachers work at schools. Policemen work at the police station.

questions.question_text: Which place would you visit to get medicine?
questions.explanation_correct: We get medicine from a medical shop, also called a chemist or pharmacy. The chemist gives us the medicine that the doctor has written on the prescription.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A toy shop sells toys, a vegetable market sells vegetables, and a library has books. We buy medicine at a medical shop or chemist.

questions.question_text: Which of these groups has ONLY places found in a neighbourhood?
questions.explanation_correct: Market, park, and post office are all places found in a neighbourhood. An ocean, jungle, and desert are not neighbourhood places.
questions.explanation_incorrect: An ocean, jungle, and desert are far from our homes. Only market, park, and post office are all common neighbourhood places.

questions.question_text: Match the helper with the correct workplace: A doctor works in a ___.
questions.explanation_correct: A doctor works in a hospital or clinic. This is where sick people go and the doctor checks them and gives treatment.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A police station is for policemen, a post office is for postmen, and a fire station is for firefighters. Doctors work in hospitals or clinics.

questions.question_text: Why should we keep our neighbourhood clean?

options.text: So that flies and mosquitoes do not spread diseases
So we can play in the dirt

questions.explanation_correct: We should keep our neighbourhood clean so that flies and mosquitoes do not spread diseases. A clean area means healthier people.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Keeping the neighbourhood clean is not just because someone told us to. It prevents diseases, keeps everyone healthy, and makes the area pleasant.

questions.question_text: A good neighbour is someone who ___.

options.text: Throws garbage in front of others' houses

questions.explanation_correct: A good neighbour helps others and is kind. Good neighbours care for each other and live peacefully together.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Playing loud music, throwing garbage, or fighting are bad habits. A good neighbour is helpful, kind, and lives peacefully with everyone.

questions.question_text: Which community helper would you call if someone is very sick at night?
questions.explanation_correct: If someone is very sick at night, we should call a doctor or an ambulance. The ambulance will take the sick person to the hospital quickly.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A shopkeeper sells things, a postman delivers mail, and a gardener tends to plants. For a medical emergency, we call a doctor or an ambulance.

questions.question_text: What should you do with garbage at home?
questions.explanation_correct: We should put garbage in the dustbin. This keeps our home and neighbourhood clean and healthy. The garbage collectors will pick it up.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Throwing garbage on the road or in the river or burning it pollutes our environment. Putting it in the dustbin is the right thing to do.

questions.question_text: How are community helpers important to us?

options.text: They help everyone and make our life easier and safer
They only work during the day

questions.explanation_correct: Community helpers are important because they help everyone and make our life easier and safer. Without them, we would not have health care, safety, or clean streets.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Community helpers are very important. They help all people, not just some. They keep us healthy, safe, and our neighbourhood running smoothly.

questions.question_text: Which of these services helps us travel from one place to another?
questions.explanation_correct: The bus stop and railway station help us travel from one place to another. Buses and trains are public transport that carry many people.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A fire station is for firefighters, a hospital is for health, and a post office is for letters. Bus stops and railway stations help us travel.

questions.question_text: Your tap at home is leaking water. Who can fix it?
questions.explanation_correct: A plumber can fix a leaking tap. Plumbers are community helpers who repair water pipes, taps, and bathroom fittings.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A doctor treats illness, a postman delivers mail, and a teacher teaches. A plumber is the right helper for fixing leaking taps and pipes.

questions.question_text: An old uncle in your neighbourhood cannot walk to the market. What can you do?

options.text: Tell him to stay home forever
Offer to buy things for him from the market

questions.explanation_correct: You can offer to buy things for him from the market. Helping elderly neighbours is a very kind and caring thing to do.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Ignoring, laughing at, or telling someone to stay home is unkind. Good neighbours help elderly people with things like shopping.

questions.question_text: Where does a firefighter keep the fire engine?
questions.explanation_correct: The fire engine is kept at the fire station. When there is a fire, the firefighters quickly get into the fire engine and rush to help.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The fire engine is not kept at home, school, or the police station. It is kept at the fire station, ready to go whenever there is a fire.

questions.question_text: People in your neighbourhood celebrate different festivals. This shows that ___.

options.text: People of different cultures live together

questions.explanation_correct: When different festivals are celebrated, it shows that people of different cultures and religions live together. This is a beautiful thing about our neighbourhood.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Different festivals show the diversity of our neighbourhood. People of different backgrounds live together and celebrate together, which is wonderful.

questions.question_text: Which of these is a service we find in our neighbourhood?
questions.explanation_correct: A police station is a service we find in our neighbourhood. It helps keep people safe. Oceans, mountains, and volcanoes are not neighbourhood services.
questions.explanation_incorrect: An ocean, mountain, and volcano are natural features far from our homes. A police station is a neighbourhood service that keeps us safe.

questions.question_text: A hospital is a place where sick people go to get better.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, a hospital is where sick people go to get better. Doctors and nurses take care of patients and give them medicine.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. A hospital has doctors, nurses, and medicine to help sick people recover and get healthy again.

questions.question_text: The postman works at the fire station.
questions.explanation_correct: The postman does not work at the fire station. The postman works at the post office and delivers letters and parcels to our homes.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is false. Firefighters work at the fire station. The postman works at the post office, sorting and delivering mail.

questions.question_text: We should throw garbage in the dustbin, not on the road.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, we should always throw garbage in the dustbin. This keeps our roads and neighbourhood clean and prevents diseases.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. Throwing garbage on the road is wrong. It makes the area dirty and smelly. We should always use a dustbin.

questions.question_text: A park is a place where we can play and enjoy fresh air.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, a park is a lovely place where we can play, run around, sit under trees, and enjoy fresh air. Many parks have swings and slides too.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. Parks are open spaces with grass, trees, and play areas. They are great places for children and families to enjoy.

questions.question_text: A shopkeeper delivers letters to homes.
questions.explanation_correct: A shopkeeper does not deliver letters. A shopkeeper sells things in a shop. The postman is the one who delivers letters to our homes.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is false. The shopkeeper sells goods like groceries and stationery. The postman is the community helper who delivers letters.

questions.question_text: We should help our neighbours when they need us.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, we should help our neighbours. Being helpful and kind makes our neighbourhood a happy and safe place for everyone.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. Helping neighbours is very important. When we help each other, our whole neighbourhood becomes a better place to live.

questions.question_text: The fire station and police station both help keep our neighbourhood safe.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, both the fire station and police station help keep our neighbourhood safe. Firefighters protect us from fires and policemen protect us from crime.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. Firefighters at the fire station fight fires, and policemen at the police station prevent crime. Both keep us safe.

questions.question_text: A bank is a place where we buy food.
questions.explanation_correct: A bank is not a place where we buy food. A bank is where people save their money and keep it safe. We buy food at the market or a shop.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is false. We buy food at markets or shops. A bank is where people deposit and withdraw money.

questions.question_text: Playing loud music late at night disturbs our neighbours.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, playing loud music late at night disturbs our neighbours. Good neighbours are careful about noise so that everyone can rest peacefully.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. Loud music at night does not let neighbours sleep. Being considerate about noise is part of being a good neighbour.

questions.question_text: Community helpers are people who help make our neighbourhood a better place.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, community helpers like doctors, postmen, policemen, firefighters, and sweepers all work to make our neighbourhood a better and safer place to live.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. Community helpers serve our neighbourhood in many ways - from keeping us healthy and safe to delivering mail and cleaning streets.
